info.title: Fabric CA Server API
info.description: Hyperledger Fabric CA Server APIs provides certificate authority services for the blockchain.

CAName.description: The name of the root CA associated with this server

CAChain.description: Base 64 encoded PEM-encoded certificate chain of the server's signing certificate

IssuerPublicKey.description: Base 64 encoding of proto bytes of the CA's Idemix issuer public key

IssuerRevocationPublicKey.description: Base 64 encoding of PEM-encoded bytes of the CA's Idemix issuer revocation public key

post.description: Enroll a new identity and return an enrollment certificate.

certificate_request.description: A PEM-encoded string containing the CSR (Certificate Signing Request) based on PKCS #10.

profile.description: The name of the signing profile to use when issuing the certificate.

label.description: The label used in HSM operations

caname.description: Name of the CA to direct traffic to within server.

attr_reqs.description: An array of attribute requests to be placed into the enrollment certificate

name.description: The name of the attribute being requested to put into the enrollment certificate.

optional.description: Boolean indicating whether the attribute is optional. An error is returned if the attribute is required but not found. The default value is false.

Cert.description: The enrollment certificate in base 64 encoded format.

CAName.description: The name of the CA that issued the credential

CAChain.description: Base 64 encoded PEM-encoded certificate chain of the CA's signing certificate

IssuerPublicKey.description: Base 64 encoding of proto bytes of the CA's Idemix issuer public key

IssuerRevocationPublicKey.description: Base 64 encoding of PEM-encoded bytes of the CA's Idemix issuer revocation public key

post.description: Get an Identity Mixer credential. Identity Mixer credential issuance is a two step process. First, a request with empty request body is sent to this endpoint. The Fabric CA server will respond back with a nonce. This nonce should be used to create a credential request. Next, a request with the credential request in the request body is sent to this endpoint. The server will respond back with a credential.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: **basic** <base64 encoding of userid:password> (OR) **token** <An enrollment token consisting of two base 64 encoded parts separated by a period:  an enrollment certificate; a signature over the certificate and body of request>

caname.description: Name of the CA to direct this request to within the Fabric CA server

201.description: Successfully returned a nonce or Identity Mixer credential

Credential.description: The credential in base64 encoding of the bytes of the idemix.Credential proto buffer

Nonce.description: The nonce in base 64 encoded format

OU.description: The Organizational Unit of the identity that requested the credential

Role.description: Represent the role value of an identity

EnrollmentID.description: The enrollment ID of the identity that requested the credential

CRI.description: The cri base64 encoding of the bytes of the idemix.CredentialRevocationInformation proto buffer

CAName.description: The name of the CA that issued the credential

CAChain.description: Base 64 encoded PEM-encoded certificate chain of the CA's signing certificate

IssuerPublicKey.description: Base 64 encoding of proto bytes of the CA's Idemix issuer public key

IssuerRevocationPublicKey.description: Base 64 encoding of PEM-encoded bytes of the CA's Idemix issuer revocation public key

post.description: Gets an Idemix Credential Revocation Information (CRI)

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: An authorization token based on Idemix credential or X509 certificate

caname.description: Name of the CA to send the request to within the Fabric CA server.

cri.description: base64 encoding of the proto bytes of idemix.CredentialRevocationInformation

post.description: Reenroll an enrollment certificate.  This is useful for renewing an enrollment certificate before it expires or because it has been compromised.

request.description: A PEM-encoded string containing the CSR (Certificate Signing Request) based on PKCS #10.

profile.description: The name of the signing profile to use when issuing the certificate.

label.description: The label used in HSM operations

caname.description: Name of the CA to direct traffic to within server.

attr_reqs.description: An array of attribute requests to be placed into the enrollment certificate

name.description: The name of the attribute being requested to put into the enrollment certificate.

optional.description: Boolean indicating whether the attribute is optional. An error is returned if the attribute is required but not found. The default value is false.

Cert.description: The enrollment certificate in base 64 encoded format.

CAName.description: The name of the CA that issued the credential

CAChain.description: Base 64 encoded PEM-encoded certificate chain of the CA's signing certificate

IssuerPublicKey.description: Base 64 encoding of proto bytes of the CA's Idemix issuer public key

IssuerRevocationPublicKey.description: Base 64 encoding of PEM-encoded bytes of the CA's Idemix issuer revocation public key

post.description:
Register a new identity with the Fabric CA server.   
An enrollment secret is returned which can then be used, along with the enrollment ID, to enroll a new identity.   
The caller must have **hf.Registrar** authority.

id.description: The enrollment ID which uniquely identifies an identity

type.description: The type of the identity (e.g. *user*, *app*, *peer*, *orderer*, etc)

secret.description: The enrollment secret.  If not provided, a random secret is generated.

affiliation.description:
The affiliation of the new identity.
 If no affliation is provided, the affiliation of the registrar is used.

attrs.description: An array of attribute names and values to give to the registered identity.

ecert.description: A value of true indicates that this attribute should be included in an enrollment certificate by default

caname.description: Name of the CA to direct traffic to within server.

secret.description: The base64 encoded enrollment secret of the newly registered identity.

post.description:
Perform revocation of one of the following:  
* a specific certificate identified by a serial number and AKI (Authority Key Identitifer), or   
* all certificates associated with the identity and prevent any future enrollments for this identity.   
The caller must have the **hf.Revoker** attribute.

id.description:
The enrollment ID of the identity whose certificates are to be revoked, including both enrollment certificates and transaction certificates. 
All future enrollment attempts for this identity will be rejected.   
If this field is specified, the *serial* and *aki* fields are ignored.

aki.description:
The Authority Key Identifier of the certificate which is to be revoked.   
The *serial* field must also be specified.

serial.description:
The serial number of the certificate which is to be revoked.   
The *aki* (Authority Key Identifier) field must also be specified.

reason.description:
The reason for revocation.   
See https://godoc.org/golang.org/x/crypto/ocsp for valid values.   
The default value is 0 (ocsp.Unspecified).

caname.description: Name of the CA to direct traffic to within server.

gencrl.description: When this request results in revoking one or more certificates, this boolean indicates whether to generate a CRL and return it in the response

Serial.description: Serial number of the revoked certificate

AKI.description: Authority Key Identifier (AKI) of the revoked certificate

revokedafter.description: Include certificates that were revoked after this UTC timestamp (in RFC3339 format) in the CRL

revokedbefore.description: Include certificates that were revoked before this UTC timestamp (in RFC3339 format) in the CRL

expireafter.description: Include revoked certificates that expire after this UTC timestamp (in RFC3339 format) in the CRL

expirebefore.description: Include revoked certificates that expire before this UTC timestamp (in RFC3339 format) in the CRL

caname.description: Name of the CA to send the request to within the Fabric CA server.

get.description:
List all affiliations equal to and below the caller's affiliation.  
The caller must have **hf.AffiliationMgr** authority.

200.description: List all affiliations equal to and below the caller's affiliation.

post.description:
Create a new affiliation.  
The caller must have **hf.AffiliationMgr** authority.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If any of the parent affiliations do not exist and **force** is true, create all parent affiliations also

caname.description: Name of the CA to send the request to within the Fabric CA server.

name.description: The affiliation path that was created.

caname.description: Name of the CA containing this affiliation.

get.description:
List a specific affiliation at or below the caller's affinity.  
The caller must have **hf.AffiliationMgr** authority.

parameters.name: affiliation
parameters.description: An affiliation path

200.description: List a specific affiliation equal to and below the caller's affiliation.

put.description:
Rename an affiliation.  
The caller must have **hf.AffiliationMgr** authority.

parameters.name: affiliation
parameters.description: An affiliation path

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If any identities are associated with this affiliation, force causes these identities' affiliations to be renamed; otherwise, an error is returned

caname.description: Name of the CA to send the request to within the Fabric CA server.

200.description: List a specific affiliation equal to and below the caller's affiliation.

delete.description:
Delete an affiliation.  
The caller must have **hf.AffiliationMgr** authority.

parameters.name: affiliation
parameters.description: An affiliation path

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If there are any child affiliations or any identities are associated with this affiliation or child affiliations, force causes these identities and child affiliations to be deleted; otherwise, an error is returned

200.description: List the affiliation(s) and any identities which were deleted.

get.description:
List all identities that the caller is entitled to see.  
The caller must have **hf.Registrar** authority.

200.description: List of identities visible to the caller.

id.description: The enrollment ID which uniquely identifies an identity

type.description: The type of the identity (e.g. *user*, *app*, *peer*, *orderer*, etc)

name.description: The affiliation path of the new identity.

attrs.description: An array of attribute names and values to give to the new identity.

ecert.description: A value of true indicates that this attribute should be included in an enrollment certificate by default

caname.description: Name of the CA containing these identities.

post.description:
Create a new identity with the Fabric CA server.   
An enrollment secret is returned which can then be used, along with the enrollment ID, to enroll a new identity.   
The caller must have **hf.Registrar** authority.

id.description: The enrollment ID which uniquely identifies an identity

type.description: The type of the identity (e.g. *user*, *app*, *peer*, *orderer*, etc)

secret.description: The enrollment secret.  If not provided, a random secret is generated.

affiliation.description: The affiliation path of the new identity.

attrs.description: An array of attribute names and values to give to the new identity.

ecert.description: A value of true indicates that this attribute should be included in an enrollment certificate by default

caname.description: Name of the CA to direct traffic to within server.

id.description: The enrollment ID which uniquely identifies an identity

type.description: The type of the identity (e.g. *user*, *app*, *peer*, *orderer*, etc)

affiliation.description: The affiliation path of the new identity.

attrs.description: An array of attribute names and values to give to the new identity.

ecert.description: A value of true indicates that this attribute should be included in an enrollment certificate by default

caname.description: Name of the CA containing this identity.

get.description:
Get an identity.  
The caller must have **hf.Registrar** authority.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An enrollment ID

200.description: The identity information associated with the ID.

id.description: The enrollment ID which uniquely identifies an identity

type.description: The type of the identity (e.g. *user*, *app*, *peer*, *orderer*, etc)

affiliation.description: The affiliation path of the new identity.

attrs.description: An array of attribute names and values to give to the new identity.

ecert.description: A value of true indicates that this attribute should be included in an enrollment certificate by default

caname.description: Name of the CA containing this identity.

put.description:
Update an existing identity.   
The caller must have **hf.Registrar** authority.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An enrollment ID

type.description: The new type of the identity (e.g. *user*, *app*, *peer*, *orderer*, etc)

affiliation.description: The affiliation path of the identity.

attrs.description: An array of attribute names and values to add or modify for the identity.  If the value is omitted, delete the attribute.

ecert.description: A value of true indicates that this attribute should be included in an enrollment certificate by default

caname.description: Name of the CA to direct traffic to within server.

id.description: The enrollment ID which uniquely identifies an identity

type.description: The type of the identity (e.g. *user*, *app*, *peer*, *orderer*, etc)

secret.description: The enrollment secret which is only present if the secret was updated in this request.

affiliation.description: The affiliation path of the identity.

attrs.description: An array of attribute names and values to give to the new identity.

ecert.description: A value of true indicates that this attribute should be included in an enrollment certificate by default

caname.description: Name of the CA containing this identity.

delete.description:
Delete an existing identity.   
The caller must have **hf.Registrar** authority.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An enrollment ID

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Required to delete your own identity

id.description: The enrollment ID which uniquely identifies an identity

type.description: The type of the identity (e.g. *user*, *app*, *peer*, *orderer*, etc)

affiliation.description: The affiliation path of the identity.

attrs.description: An array of attribute names and values to give to the new identity.

ecert.description: A value of true indicates that this attribute should be included in an enrollment certificate by default

caname.description: Name of the CA containing the deleted identity.

get.description:
Get certificate(s).  
The caller will be able to view certificates that it owns. In addition, if the caller has **hf.Registrar.Roles** or **hf.Revoker** attribute, it will be able to view certificates for identities that have affiliations equal to or below the caller's affiliation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The enrollment ID that uniquely identifies an identity

parameters.name: aki
parameters.description: The AKI for a certificate

parameters.name: serial
parameters.description: The serial number for a certificate

parameters.name: revoked_start
parameters.description: Get revoked certificates starting at the specified time, either as timestamp (RFC3339 format) or duration (-30d)

parameters.name: revoked_end
parameters.description: Get revoked certificates before the specified time, either as timestamp (RFC3339 format) or duration (-15d)

parameters.name: expired_start
parameters.description: Get expired certificates starting at the specified time, either as timestamp (RFC3339 format) or duration (-30d)

parameters.name: expired_end
parameters.description: Get expired certificates before the specified time, either as timestamp (RFC3339 format) or duration (-15d)

parameters.name: notexpired
parameters.description: Don't return expired certificates

parameters.name: notrevoked
parameters.description: Don't return revoked certificates

success.description: Boolean indicating if the request was successful.

certs.description: An array of base64 encoded PEM-encoded certificates

caname.description: Name of the CA containing this identity.

id.description: The enrollment ID which uniquely identifies an identity

type.description: The type of the identity (e.g. *user*, *app*, *peer*, *orderer*, etc)

affiliation.description: The affiliation path of the new identity.

attrs.description: An array of attribute names and values to give to the new identity.

ecert.description: A value of true indicates that this attribute should be included in an enrollment certificate by default

caname.description: The name of the root CA associated with this server.

errors.description: An array of error messages (code and message)

code.description: Integer code denoting the type of error.

messages.description: An array of information messages (code and message)

code.description: Integer code denoting the type of message.

success.description: Boolean indicating if the request was successful.

enrollmentToken.name: Authorization

ca.name: ca
ca.description: The name of the CA to direct this request to within the server, or the default CA if not specified
